messages.message:
:alarm: *24.07 certify is blocked*

Howdy! I need some help with failing dependency installs in the `server-nginx` build on `24.07.0-enterprise`

https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/deploy-service-v2/1315410/consoleFull
Failing with things like:
```12:07:33  Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'date-fns/endOfMonth' in '/tmp/workspace/8e479a6d-01e9-4ec5-a7d8-9fc1bab6fbb1/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/node_modules/@instabase.com/pollen/node_modules/react-datepicker/dist'```
I have zero clue how anything frontend related works, so I'll need a hand digging into this one

We can't certify 24.07 until we get this one ironed out :confused:
Weird, we’re seeing this in a build off of master as well: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C058UFAGWTF/p1728502796558259?thread_ts=1728499236.483869&cid=C058UFAGWTF
I don’t believe anything’s changed recently with our frontend packages though

:man-shrugging::skin-tone-3:
Perhaps an NPM outage, I'll take a peek

On a page that means absolutely nothing to me, NPM is up and fine. lol
https://status.npmjs.org/

Small chance it's a weird stuck node, but Jenkins doesn't tell me anything of use so I'm not sure. It seems unlikely, but also... the evidence is mounting. lmao

A spot check of the deploy-service-v2 (https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/deploy-service-v2/) runs today reveals that they are all failing on `server-nginx`, across multiple branches, and they all appear to have been run on the same node that I just deleted.

We'll see if any of the rebuilds pass. If not there's probably something wacky with the stupid builder and I'll see what I can see
Seems it might get past this nonsense this time: https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/deploy-service-v2/1315420/console

Ok, rescinding the :alarm:, just Jenkins being... well, its normal painful self. :upside_down_face:

Apologies for the blast, it didn't look like something that was failing due to a builder instance issue by the normal patterns - think we're good now, I'll kick sandboxes again as needed. :+1:
